hero.core_tension: Choose a limited co-brand drop to capture buyers within 48 hours while protecting margin versus a blanket holiday discount.
hero.setting: Backroom strategy table in a branded store-studio. Low table, sample boxes, printed promo cards. Angle: three-quarter, over-shoulder on the operator. Material cues: matte paper, textured card stock, raw wood.
hero.persona: Head of Brand with Head of Stores and Head of Promotions visible
hero.action: Operator stamps a promo card '48-HR' and hands a single co-branded sample to the store lead, committing to a surprise drop test (S2).
hero.urgency_symbol: A compact analog clock face set to 48 hours, rendered as a subtle badge on the table.
props: Co-brand sample box with a limited-run label
Promo_code printed cards labeled for reserve pickup
Partner brief folded on matte paper referencing limited collab terms
hero.lighting: Polished editorial lighting with confident highlights on hands and the stamped card. Clean negative space around the table.
hero.alt: Head of Brand choosing a surprise co-brand 48-hour drop test

signal_map.structure: Concentric rings with radial arcs and connecting lattice. Inner ring marks 0-48 hours, outer ring marks 49-168 hours. Two metric bands run as labeled arcs.
elements: Promo_code tokens placed on the inner ring
Store pins and digital cohort tokens on radial paths
Measurement ticks showing early-window share and tracked response rate
signal_map.motion: Flows from exposure nodes at the rim toward inner-ring redeems. Arrows and fading trails emphasize speed of conversion into the 48-hour cell.
signal_map.palette: Muted neutrals with two confident accent tones: deep teal for early-window share, warm copper for tracked response rate. Materials: matte paper textures and metallic pin highlights.
signal_map.alt: Head of Digital reviewing early-window share and tracked response rate map for co-brand and agent tests

case_studies.scene: In-store activation staged like a mini-studio. A small cluster of attendees guided from demo table to a pickup counter. Composition: overhead three-quarter to show flow. Materials: matte wood podium, ceramic product plinth.
case_studies.moment: A store associate scans a promo_code and hands a reservation ticket for same-day pickup, illustrating routing attendees to immediate purchase (S5).
case_studies.persona: Head of Stores executing a store-as-studio activation
props: Wristbands for attendees indicating immediate-buy access
Product on minimal pedestal with a single spotlight
case_studies.lighting: Spotlit product with soft ambient fill; clean negative space around transaction area.
case_studies.alt: Head of Stores running a store activation routing attendees to immediate purchase

case_studies.scene: Small operations studio with an operator passing a physical token labeled 'agent prompt' to a fulfillment lead. Composition: close mid-shot, slight low angle to show handoff and collaboration. Materials: matte card stock, metal token.
case_studies.moment: Head of Digital enables an agent-assisted checkout prompt for a test cohort, symbolized by placing the token into a cohort stack (S3).
case_studies.persona: Head of Digital enabling agent-assisted checkout prompt
props: Agent prompt token stamped with cohort ID
Printed session heatmap and conversion notes
Stack of promo_code cards labeled 'agent cohort'
case_studies.lighting: Clean editorial light with a confident highlight on the token and hands. Negative space frames the handoff.
case_studies.alt: Head of Digital enabling agent-assisted checkout prompt test
